result.execSummary:
The defendant Jean L Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to obtain her drivers license.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to Co Jail/HOC
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date February 17, 2017

1:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Agent Deb Duel present in court.  Balance $240.15.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by the defendant.  Court finds defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Court informs the defendant that if not paid off, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jean L Clark
Current: 246 N Washington St  Apt 206, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2015)
Prior: W3745 Sth 21, Redgranite, WI 54970

9:49 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  14 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 years.

-Defendant is to obtain her drivers license.
-Court costs 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants Huber if revoked.

Court adjourned at 9:57 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-17-2015 09:30 am

2:11 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant had a family emergency and this matter would likely be resolved.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on August 17, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:11 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-07-2015 01:30 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-01-2015 02:00 pm

3:26 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and requests additional time.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on June 1, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:27 p.m.
State's
Status hearing at 04-20-2015 03:00 pm

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 20, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:04 p.m.
Defendant's
Waushara County Jail - 03/16/2015 at 1:00 p.m. (Initial Appearance)
Barbara Privat

Per Barb in the PD's office, the defendant is in the Waushara County Jail.  A writ will need to be done for the next hearing date of 03/16.
43
Initial appearance at 03-16-2015 01:00 pm

9:46 a.m.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Public Defendner Barbara Privat appears for the Defendant; however, has not had contact with the Defendant.  Lisa Vanden Branden Assistant DA for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court issues a warrant on the non appearance of the Defendant.  Stayed until Monday, March 16, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  Statement by Attorney Privat.  If Defendant does not appear, a warrant will be issued.
